title: A declaration. The Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, having received several informations, that there have been divers tumults, ryots, outrages, and misdemeanors lately committed in sundry parts of this realm by unquiet and discontented spirits, ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
publisher: Printed by John Macock, and Francis Tyton, Printers to the House of Lords,
notes: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
"All sheriffs, &c., in office 25 April 1660 are to continue in their offices, using the King's style and name, and suppress the riots and rumors. All soldiers to aid them." -- Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
